lines.gurmukhi: sill invws jYsy mIn kI n GtY ruc; dIpk pRgws GtY pRIiq n pqMg kI [

Unknown.translation: Just as penchant for water for a fish never decreases and a moth's love for the flame of an oil lamp never wanes.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: jl ivc invws rKidAwˆ hoieAwˆ mCI dI rucI lwlsw jIkUM GitAw nhIˆ krdI inq nvIˆ hI rihMdI hY, Aqy dIvy dy aujwly nUM qkidAwˆ pqMgy dI pRIqI nhIˆ GitAw krdI[

lines.gurmukhi: kusm subws jYsy iqRpiq n mDup kau; aufq Akws Aws GtY n ibhMg kI [

Unknown.translation: Just as a black bee is never satiated enjoying the fragrance of the flowers, a bird's desire to fly in sky never decreases.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: Pulwˆ dI sugMDI lYˆidAwˆ ijs qrHwˆ BOry nUM r`j nhIˆ AOˆdw Aqy AwkwS ivKy aufidAwˆ pMCI dI Aws nhIˆ GtdI ArQwq AMdroˆ iP`kw nhIˆ ipAw krdw[

lines.gurmukhi: Gtw GnGor mor cwqRk irdY aulws; nwd bwd suin riq GtY n kurMg kI [

Unknown.translation: Just as hearing the thunder of the collected clouds gladens the heart of a peacock and the rain-bird, and love of a deer for hearing the sweet music of Chanda Herha does not diminish.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: bdlwˆ dI Gwt dI GnGor gVg`j sux sux ky jIkUM mor qy ppIhy dy AMdr hulws auCilAw krdw hY; Aqy ijs qrHwˆ vwjy dI nwd DunI nUM suxidAwˆ suxidAwˆ kurMg imrg dI riq pRIq iP`kI nhIˆ ipAw krdI[

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy ipRA pRym rs rsk rswl sMq; Gtq n iqRsnw pRbl AMg AMg kI [424[

Unknown.translation: So is the love of a Guru-conscious saint, the seeker of ambrosial nectar for his dear True Guru. The longing of love for his Guru that has permeated in every limb of his body and is flowing rapidly never decreases.  (424)
